it.polimi.ingsw.cg11.communication.server

Class GamesManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.cg11.communication.server.GamesManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GamesManagerRemote, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class GamesManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements GamesManagerRemote
    Singleton. It's the entity of the server that knows what games are currently playing and offers a common interface for our communication system to actually create, join, play a game (and more!) It is also responsible to sending an action to the controller of a single game
    Author:
    GerlandoSavio, Matteo Pagliari
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addUser

        public java.util.UUID addUser(java.lang.String username)
        Adds a user to the 'server' with its nickname, and returns its UUID. It is used when initializing a new client.
        Specified by:
        addUser in interface GamesManagerRemote
        Parameters:
        username -
        Returns:
        clientID

      • getGamesInformation

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGamesInformation()
        Generates a list with the information regarding the games currently running on the server. Those information include the number of players of the game, the number of clients that need to join the game before starting and the map in which the game is taking place.
        Specified by:
        getGamesInformation in interface GamesManagerRemote
        Returns:
        List one string for each game

      • createGame

        public boolean createGame(int numberOfPlayers,
                 java.lang.String mapName,
                 java.util.UUID clientId,
                 CommunicationType communicationType,
                 SubscriberInterface subscriber)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new game to host and sets it in a state in which it's waiting for all the players to join. The new game is added to the list of games currently hosted by the server and the first player of the game has its UUID assigned
        Specified by:
        createGame in interface GamesManagerRemote
        Parameters:
        numberOfPlayers -
        mapName -
        clientId - the UUID of the client
        communicationType - the type of communication used by the client (RMI or Sockets)
        subscriber - the interface which provides the dispatch message method
        Returns:
        a boolean which represents the outcome, false if the UUID is already assigned to a game.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • joinGame

        public boolean joinGame(java.util.UUID clientId,
               int gameNumber,
               CommunicationType communicationType,
               SubscriberInterface subscriber)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a client as a player to a game already created. If all the players are assigned to a client then the game can start.
        Specified by:
        joinGame in interface GamesManagerRemote
        Parameters:
        clientId - the id of the player requesting to join a game
        gameNumber - the number of the game as it appears on the list of games hosted
        communicationType - RMI or Sockets, so as to let the broker know how to send messages to the player
        subscriber - the interface which provides the dispatch message method
        Returns:
        boolean false if the client is already in another game or the game is already full
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • action

        public boolean action(java.util.UUID clientId,
             java.lang.String actionType,
             java.lang.String parameters)
        Sends an action to the If it's not the turn of the player sending the action it returns false;
        Specified by:
        action in interface GamesManagerRemote
        Parameters:
        clientId - the id of the sender
        actionType - the name of the action
        parameters - the optional parameters for the action, i.e. a coordinate in string form or the name of an item
        Returns:
        boolean the outcome of the action

      • query

        public ResponseMessage query(java.util.UUID clientId,
                    java.lang.String queryType)
        The first handler of a query, if the client asks for informations about all the games currently hosted on the server then the games manager replies directly, otherwise if it's a query specific to a game we delegate the task to a controller
        Specified by:
        query in interface GamesManagerRemote
        Parameters:
        clientId - the unique id of the client
        queryType - the name of the query
        Returns:
        the response message to send to the client

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        clientId - the id of the sender
        chatMessage - the message to share
